title: Street Food Safety: The Real Numbers
description: A micro-lesson that makes Street Food Safety: The Real Numbers usable.

hook.text: Tourists fear street food illness. Data shows restaurants cause more foodborne illness than street vendors.

buildup.text: WHO studies found that street food in developing countries has comparable safety to restaurant food.

climax.text: Singapore's hawker centers solved this with regulated water, inspections, and hygiene grades displayed publicly.

punchline.text: The safest street food is the busiest stall. Fast turnover beats fancy kitchens.
